Name: Winged scarab
Description: This scarab is rather coarsely modelled, although every detail of the body is shown. It is set into a wide, oval base. In front of the head is a hole for suspension. The holes on the sides were meant for attaching the wings. The tips of the wings are slightly bent outwards. The feathers have been differentiated into flight feathers, lesser and greater coverts.Winged scarabs were placed on the mummy's chest. They were sewn onto or worked into the bead net that covered it.
